meanings.definition: Used as a mild oath or expression of annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Goldarn! I stubbed my toe on the table.
meanings.sent2: Oh, goldarn it! I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: Well, goldarn it all, I spilled my drink on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The rain ruined our picnic, goldarn it!
meanings.sent5: Goldarn, why does everything always go wrong for me?

meanings.definition: To use 'goldarn' as a substitute for a stronger swear word.
meanings.sent1: I always goldarn my words around kids.
meanings.sent2: She goldarned loudly when she dropped the vase.
meanings.sent3: He goldarned his frustration at the broken computer.
meanings.sent4: The chef goldarned when he burned the souffle.
meanings.sent5: Don't goldarn in front of your grandma, she doesn't like it.

meanings.definition: An intensifier used to emphasize a point.
meanings.sent1: She was goldarn tired after the long hike.
meanings.sent2: He ran goldarn fast to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The cat was goldarn curious about the new toy.
meanings.sent4: The storm was goldarn loud last night.
meanings.sent5: I am goldarn sure I left my keys on the table.
